image.description: Rafaela Souza Lima, 17, a student from the city of Inaj치 holds her son Marcos Guilherme, born in July 2015 as she tries to schedule a tomography for him at a hospital in Recife, Brazil, Wednesday, January, 20, 2016. The city has been the national epicenter of hundreds of cases of microcephaly linked to a Zika virus outbreak that has its roots on poor sanitation, unattended garbage and urban sprawl. These factors contribute to Aedes aegypt mosquitoes' proliferation and along with them the viruses that use it as vector, like dengue, zika and chikungunya. (Hilaea Media/Dado Galdieri for Financial Times)
